00003 /*
00004  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8, "Unlike UTF-16, byte values of 0 (The ASCII
00005  NUL character) do not appear in the encoding unless U+0000 (the Unicode NUL
00006  character) is represented. This means that string functions from the standard C
00007  library (such as strcpy()) which use a null terminator will correctly handle
00008  UTF-8 strings (whereas many UTF-16 strings will be prematurely truncated by
00009  use of the standard functions)."
00010 */
